name: Great White Shark
image: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%232563eb'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EShark%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
images: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%232563eb'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EShark%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%231e40af'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='42' fill='white'%3ECoast%20Guardian%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
quickFacts: Humans are not part of a shark's diet; most bites are cases of mistaken identity.
Sharks help keep ocean food webs in balance by preying on sick or weak animals.
Overfishing threatens many shark species more than sharks threaten people.
ecologicalBenefits: Maintain healthy fish populations by removing weak and sick individuals.
Prevent mid-level predators from overwhelming coral reefs and seagrass beds.

myths.fact: Humans are not prey. Most bites occur because a shark mistakes a surfer or swimmer for a seal and quickly lets go.
Culls remove key predators, harm ecosystems, and do not measurably reduce risk. Education and smart beach practices work better.

name: Little Brown Bat
image: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%23057857'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EBat%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
images: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%23057857'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EBat%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%2309a36b'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='42' fill='white'%3ENight%20Pollinator%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
quickFacts: Less than 1% of bats carry rabies; they avoid people.
A single bat can eat thousands of insects in one night.
Many bats pollinate plants like agave and disperse seeds.
ecologicalBenefits: Natural pest control for farms and forests.
Pollinate night-blooming plants and spread seeds that regrow forests.

myths.fact: Rabies is rare in bats, and they generally avoid people. Never handle wildlife and risk is extremely low.
Bats belong to their own order, Chiroptera, and are more closely related to primates than rodents.

name: Gray Wolf
image: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%238b7355'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EWolf%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
images: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%238b7355'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EWolf%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%236b8c42'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='42' fill='white'%3EPack%20Balance%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
quickFacts: Healthy wild wolves rarely approach people and avoid towns.
Wolves help control deer and elk populations, allowing forests to regenerate.
Livestock losses to wolves are far lower than losses to weather or disease.
ecologicalBenefits: Prevent overgrazing by keeping large herbivore numbers in check.
Create carrion that feeds scavengers like ravens and eagles.

myths.myth: Wolves are a major threat to people.
myths.fact: Documented wolf attacks on humans are extremely rare; wolves avoid human contact.
In North America, wolves account for a small fraction of livestock losses compared to weather, illness, and other predators.

sources.title: National Park Service — Wolves and Ecosystems

name: Turkey Vulture
image: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%23b45309'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EVulture%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
images: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%23b45309'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EVulture%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%238a5d1d'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='42' fill='white'%3EClean%20Crew%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
quickFacts: Vultures rarely get sick from carcasses thanks to powerful stomach acids.
By removing carrion, vultures prevent the spread of dangerous bacteria.
They prefer open fields and seldom bother live animals.
ecologicalBenefits: Rapidly clean up carcasses, reducing disease risk for other wildlife and people.
Recycle nutrients back into the ecosystem.

myths.fact: They do the opposite: their digestive system destroys harmful pathogens, preventing outbreaks.
They are scavengers that rely on already-dead animals and rarely attack living creatures.

name: Virginia Opossum
image: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%237b341e'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EOpossum%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
images: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%237b341e'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3EOpossum%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%239c4221'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='42' fill='white'%3ETick%20Eater%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
quickFacts: Opossums groom constantly and carry far fewer diseases than many urban mammals.
They eat thousands of ticks, reducing Lyme disease risk.
When threatened they "play dead" rather than attack.
ecologicalBenefits: Consume ticks, cockroaches, and other pests that bother humans.
Clean up carrion and fallen fruit, recycling nutrients.

myths.fact: They are clean, shy animals that rarely bite and help control pests.
Their low body temperature makes rabies very uncommon compared to raccoons or skunks.

sources.title: Cary Institute — Do Opossums Kill Ticks?

name: House Spider
image: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%238b5cf6'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3ESpider%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
images: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%238b5cf6'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='48' fill='white'%3ESpider%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 600 400'%3E%3Crect width='600' height='400' fill='%237236d3'/%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='50%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Georgia' font-size='42' fill='white'%3EBug%20Control%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
quickFacts: Most house spiders have venom too weak to harm humans.
They reduce indoor pests like mosquitoes and flies.
Spiders avoid people and bites are very uncommon.
ecologicalBenefits: Provide natural pest control indoors and outdoors.
Serve as food for birds and small mammals, supporting food webs.

myths.myth: House spiders are dangerous to people.
myths.fact: Common house spiders rarely bite and their venom is not medically significant for healthy adults.
Spiders quietly control pest insects; removing them can increase mosquitoes and flies.
